meanings.definition: A person who objects to the siting of something perceived as unpleasant or hazardous in their own neighborhood.
meanings.sent1: The nimby in our community protested against the construction of the new landfill nearby.
meanings.sent2: The nimby's opposition to the power plant being built close to their home caused delays.
meanings.sent3: The nimby's insistence on keeping the noisy playground away from their house made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: She was a nimby when it came to any changes in her surroundings, like a protective guardian of her street.
meanings.sent5: The nimby's fierce determination to preserve the peace of their neighborhood was admirable.

meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of the attitude of a nimby.
meanings.sent1: The nimby mindset was evident in their strong opposition to the new factory.
meanings.sent2: Her nimby views on the proposed highway extension were well-known in the town.
meanings.sent3: The nimby-like behavior of the residents led to a humorous standoff with the city council.
meanings.sent4: The nimby stance on the issue was like a protective shield around their community.
meanings.sent5: The nimby response to the construction project was swift and unwavering.
